title: Stuffed Peppers with Rice & Herbs
description: Roasted bell peppers filled with a fragrant mix of long-grain rice, fresh herbs, tomatoes and sautéed aromatics. Finished with a light drizzle of olive oil and a brief bake to meld flavors — comforting, bright, and easy to scale.

ingredients.display_name: large bell peppers (red, yellow or orange), tops removed and seeds discarded
ingredients.notes: leave stem intact if preferred for presentation; trim bottom if needed for even standing

ingredients.display_name: ripe tomato, finely diced (or 120g canned diced, drained)

ingredients.notes: for topping or folding into filling
for those who want mild heat

steps.text: Preheat oven to 190°C (375°F). Lightly brush the outside and inside of the hollowed peppers with 1 tablespoon of olive oil and place them upright in a baking dish; set aside.
Heat remaining olive oil in a medium sauté pan over medium heat. Add diced onion and a pinch of salt and cook, stirring, until softened and translucent.
Add minced garlic and paprika to the pan and sauté briefly until fragrant, about one minute, taking care not to burn the garlic.
Stir in the rinsed rice and cook, stirring, for 1–2 minutes to coat grains in oil and aromatics.
Pour in hot vegetable broth and bring to a gentle simmer. Reduce heat to low, cover, and cook until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed according to package time (approximate timing used here).

While rice cooks, dice the tomato and chop herbs. When rice is done, remove pan from heat and fold in diced tomato, chopped parsley, mint (if using), lemon juice, half the salt and pepper, and optional feta; adjust seasoning.
Spoon the warm rice-herb mixture into each prepared pepper, packing lightly but not overfilling. Drizzle a little olive oil over the filled peppers and sprinkle remaining salt and pepper on top.

Cover the baking dish loosely with foil and bake in the preheated oven until peppers are tender and filling is heated through, about 15 minutes. Remove foil for the last 5 minutes to allow tops to color slightly if desired.
Let stuffed peppers rest 5 minutes out of the oven. Finish with additional chopped parsley, a squeeze of lemon if desired, and serve warm.
